item.title: C++ coroutines: Getting rid of our mutex | The Old New Thing
item.description: Our coroutine implementation uses a mutex to guard against the race condition where a coroutine completes at the same time another thread tries to wait for its completion. The race condition in question is this one: Awaiter Completer if coroutine has not yet completed {
item.author: (Raymond Chen Follow)

item.title: Tip 312 - How to use Azure Container Registry for building and deploying .NET Core apps
item.description: When you create a container image from an application, you can store it locally, or somewhere else, like in a container registry. There are many registries to pick from, including the Azure Container Registry (opens new window). Storing your container images in Azure Container Registry comes with lots of advantages, including geo-replication (opens new window), to efficiently manage a single registry across multiple regions, integrated security and automated container building and patching (opens new window) including base image updates and task scheduling.

item.title: Testing Exceptions with xUnit and Actions
item.description: If a method you're writing throws exceptions under certain circumstances, such as through guard clauses or other expected conditions, be sure to write tests to verify this behavior. item.title: AzureFunBytes Episode - Intro to Azure Machine Learning with Henk Boelman! | Azure DevOps Blog
item.description: As a person who's been in the Ops world for most of his career machine learning and predictive services are still very new to me. An entire world of data analysis is capable of providing greater insight into what customers want, [live chat bots](https://cda.ms/21n), and make decisions. [Is machine learning just one big search on a database?](https://cda.ms/21c) What are models? How do I integrate AI services into applications I am currently building? These questions have been top of mind for me when thinking about [Artificial Intelligence](https://cda.ms/21p) and [Machine Learning](https://cda.ms/21q).
item.author: (Jay Gordon Cloud Advocate Follow)

item.title: What on Earth is this Encryption Scheme?
item.description: I have taken a couple terabytes of photos over the years, and have a mild phobia of deleting data, so I keep my photos on a Synology DiskStation NAS. I’ve got all the files on the thing: backed up to the cloud encrypted, because back in 2016, my apartment was broken into and thieves took all the electronics. I’ve been slightly paranoid ever since. The Synology NAS generally works pretty well, but the interface for decrypting a drive after booting is extremely painful.
